critique: This document pertains to an amendment regarding the Selective Service Regulations. It specifies the conditions under which a registrant with children can be placed in Class III-A, which seems to be a deferment category. The amendment excludes physicians, dentists, veterinarians, and allied specialists from this deferment if a special requisition is issued by the Director of Selective Service after being advised by the Secretary of Defense. This suggests a prioritization of military needs over family considerations in specific professions during times when specialists are needed. Given the context of the Vietnam War era, this likely reflects a national security concern. There's no clear indication of ideological tilt, immigration policy, or federalism. The executive power is being used to amend existing regulations, which is within the scope of the Universal Military Training and Service Act. The economic regulation and social inclusion aspects are not directly addressed in this amendment.
